lines.text: What little knowledge you have of enchanting items, from your experience, and you had this a little bit as well from your own enchanting: the process of enchanting a weapon into what would be considered a magical weapon is a weeks-long process. It's doable, definitely, but it's one of those things where you would have to have somebody sit down with it over a period of time, and daily instill it with that magical energy until it finds its permanence within the object.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is there anybody in town I could leave that with and pay to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A mage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mage, maybe not so much. There are other clerics.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'd be expensive, though. It's somebody's time for a week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It also seems like this is one of those towns where things are expensive. Things are expensive here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not if you know how to handle them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Right. I'll hold off on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yes, it is totally doable.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is it a thing that I can like start to do, hourly for a long, long time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wanted to yourself, yeah.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to start that process right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's what I think. Lady Keyleth has been talking about this for a long time. It's calling to her, and we're a family now, and it's her moment. We're here. They're right nearby. There's no use putting it off. Let's go to her family.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am so nervous, you guys. I'm so scared.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go. Should we go in the morning, or should we go now? Let's go now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll go in the morning.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, let's sleep it off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll take just a small nap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Small nap, and then first thing in the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk up behind Vex and I tap on her opposite shoulder and pull my hand away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's there? Hi, Pike! I'm so glad you're here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could she have one more? You need one more, Stubby, then you'll go to bed, all right? Then you'll go to bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point the bartender at the tavern goes, "Are you sure about that?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, one more!

lines.name: ASHLEY, MARISHA
lines.text: One more!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. But you're cleaning my floor." And he goes and fills everyone's drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tip him five gold and I give him a wink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He happily takes it, and the wink is a strong wink. He smiles back, but also gives you the look of like, time for bed. You all eventually finish your drinks and find your way back to your respective rooms for the evening and have a good night's rest. And on that note, we're going to go ahead and take a five-minute restroom break on our end. We'll be back here about five minutes or so, so don't go too far, and we'll kick back in the following morning for what appears to be a journey towards the Pyrah tribe of the Ashari.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so scared! I'm so nervous!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to do great! [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey guys, welcome back! We've had our break, so as the party comes to consciousness the following morning, a very heavy hangover coming from Vex for the evening of lamenting the loss of a number of financial things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here. Drink this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking Trinket for a walk. For dookies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make your beard roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, you son of a bitch. Yes! Two, two! 22!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. As you come to consciousness, Grog wakes up and shakes his head for a minute, and you look, and there is a good solid two-inch beard. Where was once the somewhat clear, stringy, fishing-line-type scruff, you're starting to see a little color come into it. This thick black root is now starting to appear at the base of the beard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) I feel so happy. So happy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is like horsehair bristles, it's very thick, and you could probably clean dishes against it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it like an Abe Lincoln beard, or do I also have a mustache?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, for you it's only coming in as a chinstrap beard, at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't judge.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I see Vex's condition and I run out to get her a coffee from the bazaar, and then do my perception check on the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're glancing about and getting coffee for her, you manage to see a cart that's just setting up this early in the morning in the bazaar. You hear some squeaking and growling and a couple of bird chirps. You look over to the side and there is one small setup that has a number of creatures and small animals and stuff set up in cages.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! As I'm running by because the coffee's hot. Hot. Oh, excuse me, would you happen to have any particular dragonites for sale? Male, preferably, but I will take female if you have one. (quietly) I'm just making it hotter when I blow on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's funny. It took a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are dragonites?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little baby dragons?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a pseudodragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You going to have a little pet, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. She glances at the coffee in your hand, "Well, I mean, we've got two that are a bit "sickly, but they're for purchase if you like."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I would love one. Give me whichever's the least sickly of the two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're both green; it's hard to tell."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I'll take the darker green one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes the cage down, and you can see there is this lethargic-looking tiny dragonite that's curled up on this small perch, and as she lifts it off, it goes (lizard noises) and scoffs at the cage. "That'll be 200 gold pieces."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, very good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, don't pay full price for a sick dragon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There you are, sir. Have a good day."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Thank you very much. Any particular tips, food-wise?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good day, sir."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay, so I run back and I go, oh, here you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, who's that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think I'm going to name him Lockheed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket looks very interested in Lockheed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He looks a little-- oh...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's nose goes up to the cage (sniffs).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is he sick?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think it's supposed to make that noise.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Do you want to do some healing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'll do just a small healing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Medicine check? Okay, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your bear shat like a fountain. Wasn't solid. I don't know what you're feeding him. It was a little runny, sorry. Roughage. He needs roughage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, get some vegetables in your diet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groans, growls)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He likes meat, what can I say?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What was I rolling for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I missed Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Checking about the health. I rolled a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't look the healthiest.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He looks really sick!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I check him out? Is he considered an animal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I check him out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, but he's a little cutie, isn't he?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like him. Can I put my finger in the cage?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Lockheed.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Lockheed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put my finger in the cage and go, hello, Lockheed!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as your finger gets to the edge, (snaps) he bites on the finger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's a real peach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a point of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe you should name him Lockheed Peach.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, Lockheed Peach.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think Lockheed is good enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check on him and see if I make him feel better?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a medicine check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Medicine check? Oh that's not bad. 19 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather this may be some sort of a general illness that lingers for a couple of weeks. Properly fed and taken care of, would probably be able to get it through its system.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reach in my pouch and pull out a few Goodberries.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reluctant to eat the first piece. Eventually, it takes a bite and then begins to eat the rest through the cage as you continue through breakfast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you speak with animals, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can, but he's not an animal. He's a dragon-guy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is he starting to look any better? Could I try healing him a little bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try healing. It's more of a disease-based illness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just feed him, lots of water--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have some dry food rations if you want to give him a nibble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I gave him some Goodberries. I'll make up some more Goodberries.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We have a bunch of food and stuff. We'll be fine. We can move on with the journey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, it's groggy, but we decided to go see your family, right? Right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I don't want to inconvenience anyone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going, Keyleth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're doing it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've always wanted to see a volcano, anyway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, it sounds lovely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sure they're all as charming as you are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You'll win them over.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You'll be fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the worst that could happen? Oh, never mind. That was rhetorical. Don't actually want to know what the worst that could happen would be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have to do a trial and meet their headmaster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Royal stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty sure you're going to be all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, you're going to do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not even that. It's sometimes learning about your past can be equally as terrifying. I don't know what I'm going to find.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, let's go discover it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, from what I heard, we head south towards Sunder Peak. Towards the southwest, it's volcanic territory.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we ask how far it is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe. I only got vague directions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we see Sunder Peak from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The landscape is very heavily wooded, and the canopy of the forest tends to rise and lower about the height of the wall itself. You can't really see anything beyond the wall of the city of Vasselheim, anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So remember that way, we found a hydra, so we might come across some terrible things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One of you wordsmiths go talk to somebody and ask directions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I flag down the nearest person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's happening. There's nothing you can do to stop this anymore. Embrace the inevitable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Asking around and gathering a few folks and asking them questions, eventually you flag down one guy at the far end of the tavern; he's an amateur cartographer who's in the middle of sketching out the nearest area. He talks to you for a bit and you mention Sunder Peak Mountains and he goes, "Oh yeah, yes, no. Sunder Peak. It's not too far from Vasselheim. It's about two days' "travel, on horseback southwest. The Sunder Peak Mountains themselves, be careful; they're pretty "steep. I haven't actually gone within the mountain range myself, but I've been within a few miles of "it just to make sure that I can mark it on my map, but yeah. It should be fine. Stay on the road."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, stay on the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you actually have a map that we could use? Borrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is not done. And I need to finish it before I can give it to a printer to make more."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's your girlfriend's name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I should go." And he folds up his map.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, wait! We'll be on the lookout for key things in the landscape to maybe give you information for your maps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that would be very helpful."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tyriok."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tyriok?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tyriok."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matthew, we've been doing this for three years, and you still fucking blow me away game after game. I'm sorry. Tyriok, I meant to say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anything you come across, please do take note of it. If you require a small piece of "parchment, I can perhaps provide that as well."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what happens if you don't stay on the road?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, forests tend to-- "

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean I have an idea, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are things that live there that are generally pretty dangerous. They've had people "who've travelled on these routes and at some point they've been attacked. Or worse, never came "back."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wow. Do you know what they've been attacked by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Hydra.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hydra?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We fought a hydra, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not as in the-- I understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, five heads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glances back over at Grog's ominous stare towards him again. "I should be leaving."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Parchment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes." Hands you this rolled-up piece, relatively well-made.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We will use this to make notes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate that greatly."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You wouldn't happen to have a compass, would you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No? Not that I can lend out."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could make a compass if we really needed one. It's not hard to make a compass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just going about my business. So whenever you need "to find me--"

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Tyriok.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes and heads off. You guys are welcome to prepare as you wish.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we need horses, right? We don't want to walk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't we have horses from our previous--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your team has horses. This team does not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we have enough horses for all of us, from our previous run.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We had two extra horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Let's just take those horses. We don't even have to pay for them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need a new horse, because mine's back, the horse--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The back buckled?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can ride the bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he can't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was pretty rough getting you there, even as a warhorse. You weigh a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So probably a new horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. You drove the horse into the ground?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so we need two extra horses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, we're getting more? Did you bust up the last one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's all like this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Let's go find a couple of horses. I'm going to ride Trinket, so we only need one extra horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A warhorse for Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes? I go get a horse for Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The cost of the warhorse. Initially, when you get there, the stablehand who you talked to originally, "You've gone already through it. I can offer you another war horse. We're starting to "run a little low, if you keep tearing through them at this rate."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we'll say we're covered though, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that's 400 gold to purchase yourself a warhorse."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, 400. Darling, remember who we are. We gave you excellent business before. I have no idea what I'm saying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, this is your thing. Come on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think, as a return customer, you can offer us more of a deal than that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on. Natural 20! (shouting)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's verified. That's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Here. How about this. I will, based on your previous patronage, and if you can "ensure that you would continue to send business my way, I would be happy to give it to you at half "price."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog. Pay the man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you be interested in negotiating? Right. 200 gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckling) Mark off 200 gold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wait, for two horses? Don't we need two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was a warhorse for him, and then there's two amongst you. I don't know if you wanted to become a horse and run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to ride Trinket so that there were three for them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You could take the busted-up horse. It just can't carry me anymore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Trinket could take Pike, too, with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, me and Pike will ride Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Well, then you're fine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is there another warhorse for sale for that price? Can we get the two for 400?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you ask about this, he's like, "That wasn't part of the deal. If you want another "warhorse, that's a different transaction entirely."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll take one. Full price. I won't bargain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "400 gold."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, but where do you put Lockheed Peach?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Well, I'm afraid we're fresh out of war horses going forward. We'll have to make "sure our tamer goes out, and probably be a few months before we get another load, so take care of "what you have."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How much extra for some side saddles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Side saddles for that? I'll throw those in for free, for full price purchase, certainly. Side "saddlebags for your warhorse."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tiberius, I want it to be known that if you keep asking me for party funds, I will not be so--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: These are my personal, of course. I would not want to upset you again, milady Vex. I have missed your company.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so charming today, Tiberius.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He called you a lady.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go see your family.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (high-pitched) Okay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And then if we get-- if we get just outside of the-- I'll wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing down for the rest of the day, eventually the sun comes to set and what little bit of moonlight that would find its way through the canopy is entirely cut off by the thickness of the leaves and boughs of the trees. You can continue to go through the night, if you wish to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Light! (igniting sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long do you want to push on forward?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm a little concerned, Tiberius. I'm afraid that some creatures might be attracted to that light source. It might actually be best to--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. (snuffing sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Darkness once again takes the pathway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any moonlight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather, glancing up, there are fractions and little pieces that give you the sense that some of the clouds have parted, and moonlight would be visible if you weren't underneath such a thick canopy of brush. If not for your darkvision and the little bit of light in there, you'd have no visual.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Light the end of your staff.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to cast Light under one of the flaps of my robe. (igniting sound)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tibs. I pull off and hand him my Cloak of Elvenkind, which is one of the reasons I'm so hard to see. Maybe we could just use that as a shroud for it, just for tonight. I'll pass it to Tibs.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (igniting sound) I'll cast it under that, and you can be the source of light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead of a beaming beacon of bright light, it has now become essentially a hood lantern that you are now directionally focusing.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Now you look really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to push on, or do we want to rest? We should push on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we're all right, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're on a path?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 9:00 at night, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 9:00 at night, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it's time to bed down. I mean, we're not in Los Angeles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far did we make it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say, from when you left, it's probably been about six hours of travel, approximately, to where you are now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, it would be smart. We've got another day's travel tomorrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Make camp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's bed down. It's not like we don't have to sleep eventually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take the first watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do my Anti-Life Shell for the first hour. That way we all get an hour of good sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I trace back a hundred yards and Dust of Tracelessness it, from where we came?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Hunter's Mark that I cast on that merchant. Did he stay in town, or is he out and about? Can I sense that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this distance?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Six measly little hours of travel. I can track it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you haggling with the fabric of time and space?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm just seeing if I can track the dude I put a Hunter's Mark on, is all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She went back to the 30s.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: See?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say, at this distance, if you've travelled you've lost contact with him, however on the way out you got the sensation that he was still in the city, just not in the thoroughfare that he was originally spotted in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mourning getting negotiated so hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to roll real quick. I was going to do animal handling; that's the roll? Animal handling every day so I can train it to do stuff? So I didn't gain a point today. And I take out the Decanter of Endless Water-- water, anybody?-- And then I'm feeding Lockheed some.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and cast some more ammunition, since I'm out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pull out my little book of druid spells and history, and I start freshening up on some fire spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I try to get Trinket to eat some vegetables.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pass the fuck out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You conk out. Trinket takes to a couple, but seems to be reluctant as it's not what he's used to. It's a good start but Trinket still likes the comfort of fresh meat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to eat some veggies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear noises) Trinket nuzzles his nose and pushes it out of your hand on to the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I have the first watch, I have darkvision, and I take out my Firebrand Warhammer as I begin my watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It burns like a torch in your hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No fire. Okay. You, because the only supplies you have to craft some ammunition without having an actual smithy at your disposal, it is possible; it's just difficult. So go ahead and take your tinker's tool check with disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God damn it. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? You use the remainder of your supplies that are currently on you. You manage to construct 12 rounds of ammunition for your Pepperbox, but you are currently out after that. And you were down to about three pieces left?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was getting a little iffy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I put you at a total of 15 bullets for your Pepperbox.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you use bulette armor to make more bullets?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can use metal. They're basically made of iron, so honestly I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have two more pieces of broken-up armor and a lantern. And manacles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you're on watch, right? Before I passed out I handed him my cloak, all wadded up in a ball around it, and handed it to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's hard for you to repurpose anything metal without an actual smelter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I knew I would just get a little bit on the road right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And you can try for the Bad News ammunition. You should be about five shots left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five shots. That sounds about enough.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So to take a long rest, I take can one hour or two hours? To still have a long rest and do stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A long rest is eight hours.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So an hour before that, I'm starting to enchant the staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Enchanting for a staff is a day focus. You can do it slowly over time to help offset that, but it'll take you a lot longer to do it on the road. It's more of like, when you get back and you want to focus on enchanting it, you can get it done. Cool. You go over your spells, you have that crafted, torch, anything else before you go to bed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I get an up to my hit points at level 11? Do I get to roll more hit points at level 11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Have you not done that yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't done anything other than take my new abilities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, well let's go ahead and do that right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll a d10?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d10 plus your constitution modifier. Percy is now level 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Welcome!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (sing the Super Mario level complete music)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's ten. I'm up ten points. Hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled an eight, and my constitution modifier is two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, ten more hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh and actually, you know what. Before we go to sleep, or actually first thing in the morning before I learn my new spells--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're also three attacks per round now, which is awesome.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, I am.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm also going to go ahead and be like, hey guys. I made breakfast! And make a Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Another Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At night or in the morning?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At night, because I had it learned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone's going to eat a Heroes' Feast before bed? Okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. How long does it last us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 24 hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's 24 hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so until we go to bed tomorrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Because I'm learning new spells in the morning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do we get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull out the second gem-encrusted bowl that you purchased in the bazaar earlier, you mark off another thousand gold pieces from your personal fund, and as you guys watch, Keyleth all of a sudden puts her hands out in front of her, and from the very earth itself around your campsite (fwoosh) springs forth this long table of cornucopias and fruits and fine meats. The smell permeates the air like the best eating hall you've ever been to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! Bananas!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is amazing, Keyleth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, man!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pick up Keyleth, I give her a big squeeze. Oh, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (choking noises) Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sorry. I drop her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try the carpet again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you're eating and chopping, you step away from the table and set the carpet down, and you grab your holy symbol, and you close your eyes, praying up to Sarenrae to hopefully in some way, shape, or form, be of an aid in restoring this once-enchanted ally.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be a zero or a one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Isn't that good, to roll a two?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She has to hit 11 or under.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You sense that once again, the attention of Sarenrae is scattered. And at this moment in time, you feel like there is little attention towards this small arcane artifact that was lost not of your own hand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know. I'm sorry, Sarenrae.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So at the top of the morning, as part of the Heroes' Feast, everyone gets 2d12--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d10. 2d10 additional hit points to your maximum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you heal that, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For a day?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We roll that right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you also fill up that, as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yay, that's amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's tight, right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tight!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, thank you for introducing that to Liam's vocabulary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, everyone now has advantage on their wisdom saving throws.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just for the day, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For 24 hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're immune to poison, immune to diseases, immune to being frightened, and all wisdom saving throws have advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Immune to being frightened? All of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel your physical form given unnatural heartiness, and the confidence instills your entire body. And so you are immune to poison, immune to disease, immune to frightened, and you get advantage on your wisdom saving throws for 24 hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I ain't afraid of no ghosts

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The opposite of tryptophan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A very fine, a very expensive meal. All right. You guys eventually find yourself getting to rest. Through the evening's rest, Grog keeping watch, eventually the weight of the meal comes to your form, and you begin to fall asleep. You all wake up in the morning untouched, unscathed, but all asleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (snoring)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You fell asleep!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! No. It was just so calm that once the sun came up, I heard you-- I fell asleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've got a lot of drool in your beard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's keep going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's good to have a good night's sleep, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yoink. Thank you. (whoosh)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry! Zero... zero!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hundred. No progression on your beard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, I thought it was like the lowest roll you could ever do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Zero means ten. That's a hundred. That's the best you can do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The lowest you can get is ten.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or 11, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all right. But you still have your fancy little Lincoln going on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They call me Honest Grog. Like Lincoln? No?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I was there. I was with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Zero, zero! Hundred.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You ride up again, you get yourself back on the path and you progress up the pathway. You continue to ride for the next six to seven or so hours, stopping briefly to eat lunch and just get your energy up.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Feed Lockheed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Leftover from the big feast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's been no change in Lockheed's health visually yet. But you continue the process. You push forward for the remainder of the day, eventually getting to the end of your second day of travel. As the sun is beginning to slowly set, you watch the direction it's passing and you can see now in the distance what appears to be a large mountain range beginning to appear above the breaks in the canopy where you can see part of the trees begin to part. There are aspects of the sky visible. You can see the clouds have regathered; there's a little bit of sunlight that breaks through every now and then, you can see just the general glow of the sky as it pushes over, but you do see the edge of a mountain range in the distance, probably no more than a couple hours of travel to get to the actual base of.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (worried sounds)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That wasn't a word.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that an Ashari song?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's good.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So how should we approach?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Approach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a sudden clap of thunder (thunderclap). Comes rumbling through the sky. And you can see, above the mountain range, the clouds that are gathering are very dark, and a roiling thunderstorm is starting to break over the mountain range. You see flashes of light from within, and a few other claps of thunder rolling over the mountain range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look natural?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a thunderstorm. It's not ominously dark more than what you're used to, but it looks like there is a thunderstorm blowing through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check, see how long it's going to hang out? Ooh, 17, that's 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a moment and watch it. It is stationary. Taking a very close look, it doesn't appear to be pouring any rain. It's just a thick gathering of black thunderclouds that has yet to release its watery payload.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think, Keyleth? Does it look safe to traverse?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It just formed, right? We watched it happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approached and noticed, you could see that the storm is there.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Apparently, your people have a taste for the theatrics.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think that's where they are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop to my knees, and I do Commune With Nature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you spend a little time focusing on the landscape around you. What's the range on that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's big. 5th-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here we go. Got it. (laugh) All right. So three miles of you. It's a little bit beyond three miles, but you gather at least within the distance there that-- nothing immediately visible, but the temperature, you can gather, gets slightly warmer as you approach the mountain range. That's the most you can gather from this distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Looks like that's the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it safe to just approach?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I did with the Earth Ashari, but I mean, they were welcoming and kind.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Maybe they will be, too. You know, maybe they just like being warm.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do they have a reputation of being--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We haven't made contact with them in almost two generations. I don't know. Last time we made contact with them it was fine, and everyone was good, but who knows. It's been a while, because my mother didn't come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is maybe awkward, but you and we share something in common. Our past is awkward. I get the sense that yours is not as much. Your people, are they a mix of many kinds?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mainly humans and elves. So we're primarily-- I guess you could say mutts. Primarily half-elven, but we separated off into our own separate tribes, so we each developed our own individual cultures, even though we came from the same root.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But predominantly a melding of humans and elves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we're accepting of all races. At least, the Air and the Earth Ashari are.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I assume they are steeped in tradition, as well, such as your own people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, absolutely. And each tribe has its own tradition. It's had a lot of time to develop.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I see. I'm going to reach in my-- Dust of Illusion, and-- (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Friendly fire!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's okay. It didn't break.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the day that Orion set himself on fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right here, on camera.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We just hit 7,000 subs when Orion set himself on fire!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It happens all the time when you bend it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sputtering, laughing)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's fine. We're all okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It touched my ass! It hit me in the ass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's, like, five jokes I'm not making right now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I just sprinkle some on myself, and I turn my scales silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (magic noise) All of your scales shift into a glistening silver color, that of the same scales that the followers of Bahamut had adorned their armor with when you went to that section of Vasselheim.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This is the color my brother Faeryn is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks good on you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. So you're a silver-colored dragonborn now?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: If they are steeped in tradition, the metallic dragonkin are more welcome in societies, more than the chromatic. As we've seen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Judging books by their cover, yes. I ride my horse around in a circle just to face everybody and say, everyone, maybe go a bit back, go behind Keyleth. Vex'ahlia and I will trail just behind as your retinue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there anything we can do to help? Or just make you feel a little bit more at ease?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know what to expect.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have this Longbottom herb you can smoke before we go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm good. I'll wait.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need her clear, Tiberius.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, what I'm most nervous about is, when I went to the Earth Tribe they said that my mother had passed through. And went through her training, and her Ulare trip, and she was fine. And then continued on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe your mother's still here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (thunder) Another lightning clap.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get a move on, I think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, we're all here behind you. You've got this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll pretend to be your small army. You are our leader.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. And please, don't mention anything about us being called the SHITs when we first got started.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Vox Machina, that's all it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, is that Kashaw? Made you look. Break the tension! Never mind, you've got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually the forest begins to give way as the ground itself becomes less and less hospitable to vegetation. There's a certain smell to the air that seems to come through the wind that buffets the bottom of the mountain range itself. It smells like a distant forest fire. Like, you can smell almost like burnt cedar, a little bit of ash to the air. You make your way to the base. Everyone roll a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nervous. 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy. Everyone else, you look about this mountain range and it's just the sheer edge, like there's no real sign, outside from climbing it up, how you'd manage to find--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Is it favored terrain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is mountainous part of your favored terrain?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, is it still mountains?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, these are mountains. You glance up, though. You notice that there is apparently two paths that diverge at the very base. They're very steep, back and forth switchback winding paths that lead up the front of the mountain. It's hard to see exactly where they lead, because once they reach a certain point the rest of the mountain cliff seems to blend into itself. But you do notice there are two maybe five-foot wide, very thin switchback paths that lead up the side of the mountain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh look, we have two options for our ways up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two paths, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two paths. I want to examine the path to see if there's one that's been more trod.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's choose the one less travelled, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That won't make much of a difference.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Glancing at the two sides, the left path appears to be far more worn. The right path is largely untouched, with a thin layer of ash coating it, so you get the feeling that one hasn't seen use in quite some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are the prints going both directions, or is there a majority going one or the other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the left side, they seem to go both ways, but even those prints are fairly old. At least a week or two has seen any sort of traction on the path.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Footprints, horse prints, both?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Footprints.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No horse prints.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you see, Percival?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we take the more common path.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you leave your horses behind? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there trees to tie them up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are some trees towards the edge here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, why are we taking the more travelled one? Do you think your family is more reclusive?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There might be more travelled ones, once again I'm not sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the one that Keyleth's people, or cousins, or whatever they are, have been taking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's try the path more travelled first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys leave your horses behind. You tie them up to one of the nearby trees, one that's off to the side, leave a little bit of feed for them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We tied them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way up the switchback path, up the side of the mountain. It is relatively steep. It continues up at about a 40-degree incline, and there are certain moments where it tends to pinch to about a two-foot-wide path, and you have to uncomfortably put your back to the side of the mountain to get through those passes. You're about, I'd say about an hour and a half, two hours later, the sun has officially set, and what little bit of moonlight would be brought forth is currently encased by the thunderstorm ahead, and you do still hear the occasional clap of thunder and see the occasional flash that almost seems to be happening above the range, out of visual sight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we need light so we don't go over the edge.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sure. (igniting sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tiberius creates a beacon of light at the edge of his staff, and being centrally located to the team, is a fairly good source of visual light to the pathway. You guys continue to go up the side. I'm going to go ahead and have everybody do a constitution saving throw here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Druid dice! Not good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's getting into your lungs a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a mask for this. I'm going to put on the mask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you pull your mask down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull my hood up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No immediate effects, but you find yourself unable to suppress an occasional cough. You continue up the side of the mountain. You guys pull your cloth up over your faces. You make your way. It's pushing almost midnight at this point in time, and you're getting tired, your legs are growing sore from the constant perpetual walk upwards at an angle. The path begins to become less of a switchback, and you can see it's beginning to pull inwards towards what looks like a ravine in the mountain range. There's an area where the actual mountain carves inward and leads into the mountain range proper. During that time, Vex, as you guys are making your way up to this slight inward path and it starts pushing into the mountain range, less dangerous and less pressed against the mountain as you were previously, you notice up at the top there are a few shadowed figures just out of your visual range that you can just make out over the backlight of the clouds in the sky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. At this distance, it's hard to really make out any sort of visual on their form, their size, but you just see there's a handful of them and it looks like three figures that are moving in unison along the ridge a little ways up ahead of you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can I go ahead and get a stealth check from the group? With disadvantage on the ones that failed their constitution saves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do we know if we failed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fail is the nine or below. Yeah. I'll let you know if it's a fail or not, but you guys, everyone has to make a stealth check, and the ones who currently have the coughs have disadvantage on the roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who has the coughs? How do we know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your clanging armor didn't do nothing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I fail? With a nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a nine? Yes, you did. You're also coughing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have been oiling my armor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She didn't have disadvantage. She rolled a 17 on her constitution.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so you were fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How did Trinket do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 15. I did not roll for Trinket for either of those things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll stealth on Trinket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mighty two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A mighty two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so annoying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know you don't have to breathe all of it in every time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, right, no. 15, sorry, 15. For stealth, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For stealth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (coughs loudly)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shushed as best you can, you can see the figures shift and then vanish from sight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we hurry? What do you think?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, they know now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do a perception check and see if I can see any sign of a village or a town or my people. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around, the pathway still continues upward, and it continues and then disappears over a ridge where the mountains come inward to the closest portion where the mountain range tends to break. You can't see anything beyond that, because it's still too far away from you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Knowing my people and my tribe, would I know if these were centurions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea. You haven't been to this territory. You know that centurions usually are sent out, and people keep watch on the landscape around, but you have no idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because I know the mountains, are we still on that crappy narrow precipice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That crappy path is starting to move inward finally towards the actual mountain; it's starting to crest over into the top area, where it goes into almost more like a ravine where the two walls of the mountain come together to give you a small valley path that leads--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I look and see if there are any boulder, avalanche-type situations that I can see--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I clarify something? Am I giving Scanlan a shoulder-ride right now, or is he knocking boots back in Vasselheim?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Scanlan... paid well for enough attention to celebrate his current non-freezing-death or smashing by a dragon. He's still recovering through the positive reinforcement of numerous female workers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I call it a tiefling trio.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's going to be art for that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't say things like that out loud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you guys continue?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I-- I mean--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's continue on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You continue pushing in, and this area where the mountain range tends to collide to this path that then leads on. It's slowly winding around and heading upward and closer and closer in towards where the mountain range crests. There's a couple more flashes of lightning, some thunder, and you all look around.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I rolled an 18, because I want to do an arcana check for anything I can feel from that storm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. Best you can gather, the storm is localized, it is not moving, and this type of storm seems to be more generated not because there is a gathering of storm activity or any natural rain that falls in this area-- and in fact, most of the rock and landscape you see here is very dry-- this usually accompanies a place of very strong power. Natural occurrences where there is a funnel or focus of some sort of unbridled arcane or divine energy tends to call this type of aberrant weather pattern to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a strange clacking sound, and you glance up just in time to see a large boulder (booming sounds) down the mountain. So for this one in particular, this would be towards the people that are in front. That would be Keyleth, Vex, Vax, and Trinket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have enough time to react?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How big is the boulder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's roughly six feet in diameter. It barrels through the vicinity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I try to do something right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll let them do the reaction first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was my number? It was 13? 13 for me, and Trinket gets 13, as well.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can I try and do something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as I finish their action, basically the boulder (smack) and they all tried to dodge out of the way, and then you can do your action.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to try to cast Telekinesis, and (whoosh).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of bludgeoning damage as the boulder slams into your side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You immediately glance up to the top, and you can now see three figures have gathered at the very top of this ridge, and you can see two more are lifting boulders.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lifting boulders?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, are they giants? Are they more fucking giants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They appear to be larger than normal humans. They are humanoid. You, with your highest perception, glance up and you can see each one has two heads across one set of shoulders. (straining noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we get in a place that boulders won't hit us? If we get right up against the cliff face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So now we see that happening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all see this happening now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cool, so as I see the next one I cast Telekinesis on the one he's about to throw and huck it right back at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. One of the boulders gets loosed; now this one's coming towards the bottom group here as Tiberius, you reach up and do that. Go ahead and roll a strength check, with the strength of the boulder, which I believe is-- (muttering) What's the strength check on this boulder?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away are they, roughly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about 45 to 50 feet up on the pathway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could just bolt. We're at the bottom of the valley.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll and add five to your d20.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay, that was 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? He rolled a five, even with his strength bonus. He throws the boulder down, the boulder smacks him right back in the face. You can see he just (groans) tips over backward out of visual range, there are now two of them currently visible at the top. All right, so go ahead and make your attack; the rest of you guys get a round. However, at this point in time as you guys are preparing, the second boulder comes crashing down towards the second half. I need Percy, Pike, Grog, and Tiberius to make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you guys want to run?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Nope. Got a solid five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dexterity saving throw. Five?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 14 on the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 14 is fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay. All but Tiberius, you guys dodge out the way. Tiberius, who's concentrating on the Telekinesis-- (impact noise) The secondary boulder, unfortunately, connects. You take 12 points of bludgeoning damage. I need you to make a concentration check. Roll a d20. Add five to it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? Yeah, you maintain concentration. As it almost knocks you off your side, you manage to (grunts) maintain your focus on the spell; your Telekinesis is still going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I try to hit him with an arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits. You go (flying arrow) you loose it and it goes hurtling up the side through the darkness and it finds purchase somewhere in the face of the entity. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the entity still lifting boulders?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two entities currently that are still up. One you can't see because it got the boulder smashed back into its face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As much as I like being targets for their lawn bowling, we are in the bottom of a fucking valley.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're in a death pit, man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys just run? Okay. You start bolting forward (heavy steps). You can see the two entities now reach over and grab rocks and start running.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Run zig-zags!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn around where they are right in front and throw up a big Wall of Stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both throw boulders overhead, now arcing, missing the entire ravine trying to get it downward.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is my thing still going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your Telekinesis is still going, yeah.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to catch one and (whoosh).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't take out my Wall of Stone!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm going to whack the dude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them rolls down, and it would have impacted except for the Wall of Stone, it hits-- let me see the strength of that-- oh, it rolled a one on its strength. The boulder slams right at the bottom of the ravine, gets even more speed as it ramps up like a bowling ball and slams into the stone wall. The stone wall (impact noise) heaves and cracks, and portions of it fall and collapse, but it does manage to stop the force of that boulder. The second one comes overhead towards you. Go ahead and make a d20 roll and add five to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Yeah, I rolled an eight. You manage to (straining) catch the boulder. It's just on the cusp of the weight limit you would have on Telekinesis, but you manage to stop it in mid-air and catch it. You're just throwing it off to the side?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm going to huck it right back to the other guy again! (swish, whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's a heavy boulder and it's a long 50-foot distance away so I'm going to go ahead and have you roll another d20 plus five.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. You manage to stop it from crushing your party, and you throw it up and it manages to roll up the side, get partway up, and then continue arcing and rolling down. Away from you guys, safely. Skee ball style.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Running!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pat Tiberius on the back as I pull him along. Run!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys keep running. You notice as you're bolting forward, the two entities that are looming reach over and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to stop, if I see one pick up a ball, I'm going to stop and take an action, if that's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to swing around, I'm going to pull Bad News out as I swing around, back myself down, and I'm taking an aimed shot at its arm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. You're spending a grit point?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spending a grit point. It's been so long. There we are. Yeah! Oh, the curse is broken, that's 29, 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31. Definitively hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does the arm shot do? It's no damage, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The arm shot is-- okay, sorry. It's been a while. I've never done this one before. No damage, but it drops one item of my choice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as it's lifting the boulder, you fire, and it hits the elbow out from under it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I use the strength of the shot to pick myself up and keep on running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an acrobatics check. So as one of them is lifting a giant boulder--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of its elbows (gunshot) out from under it (collapsing sound) as it collapses onto its head, and that one also falls out of view as the other one looks back and sets the boulder down. Starts shaking its fists at the air (angry grunting).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Rabble rabble.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In Giant I call back, fuck you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In Giant?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if it is a giant. It had two heads.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That felt really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have walked up the outside of it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A hidden valley.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The valley itself is roughly three miles across to the other side of this crested mountain range.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three miles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You notice this valley is actually a settled-in, bowl-like caldera. You realize this particular mountain was once, or possibly still is, an active volcano. As you begin to move in closer, the ground itself becomes more and more jagged, with what looks like broken obsidian rock, sharp volcanic stone and glass. It is a very warm heat that this area tends to give off, and the temperature is now significantly causing you to sweat. Not just from the run, but the severe change in temperature from what you're used to in this area of the continent.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This feels great to me. I'm stretching out my scales, letting the heat in. Oh yeah, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The air, now, the burning wooden ash smell is becoming much stronger, and you re-adjust your cloth to cover your mouth. You also, as you begin to push closer and closer towards the center, you begin to see occasional pools of ashy mud dotting the landscape, where sulfurous gas caused the liquid earth to bubble and fume in certain patches.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Lady Keyleth, is that you? Oh, it's--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, are we--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone go ahead and roll perception.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As they are doing this with their noses, I'm going to open my bottle of air and just have it (soft spraying sound).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh! 28.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is our rolls tonight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Twinsies. Twinsies rolls.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That is a negative two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Okay!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There, see?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take that, game, take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Far off in the distance, Keyleth, as the rest of you look at the landscape, you see what looks like a small forest, a very localized forest right in the center of the valley. You can see a cluster of trees that exists about a mile, a mile and a half away from your current position. As you guys continue pushing forward, you start seeing larger stone clusters and formations, almost like a very violent activity were forcing and jutting up portions of stone out of this caldera at some point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if it's natural, from earthquakes, or if earthbenders have done it? 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at it, it appears that a lot of it appears to be natural, but there are portions that appear to be sculpted or have sections that are cleaved off or taken by possible tools for use of building or other purposes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And most of it appears to be obsidian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Front, back, side to side, and a fifth one closes the top off. You are now left in complete darkness, imprisoned in what seems to be some sort of a stone cube.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What? (Light sound effect)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really bright in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look around indeed, relatively rough-looking stone walls have completely encapsulated you guys on all five sides. You are all entirely trapped inside the structure about 40 feet high and 40 feet across.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We dig? We dig down? Can we dig?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think a Fireball can do this-- no I'm just kidding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take the warhammer, activate it and run up towards the walls and swing as hard as I can into one of the walls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll a strength check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (strained wince)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I assist?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) If you want to. You rush up with you mace, as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you don't need assistance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I do. From Pike, anytime.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the two of you together slam your weapons into the side of the wall, a portion of the stone cracks a little and chips fall out, but the stone still stands pretty solidly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody stop! Keyleth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see through it where they chipped away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where they chipped away, there's still more stone behind. You're not sure how thick these walls are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We just wait or Keyleth talks. Wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About a moment later, you see a small red glow appear from a portion of the wall on the opposite side. Red glow, looking like a portion of the stone, about this wide, begins to glow bright red before dripping off molten, leaving a small slit. You can now see through the slit, a few heads appearing as one steps into, eyes, shifting, peering through the small space. "You trespass "into our home. I will ask you once your business before we let the mountain's fury take you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please. I am Keyleth of the Air Ashari, and I am here to further my Aramente.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks back for a second. Go ahead and make a persuasion roll with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I kneel down toward Keyleth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I bow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I look around and I'm like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Persuasion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we assist?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're doing it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Persuasion's not good. Ten.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't bow. I'm still at her side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, Keyleth of the Air Ashari, you know of our people, you trek up here with a group of strangers "at your sides, welcome weapons at the ready. I ask you, for the Aramente, whom do you call family? "Whom gave you to this world?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My mother was my predecessor. Wait, no, that's-- right? Yes, predecessor.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, your Highness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She followed in my path. I'm following in her path.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The eyes have now moved away from the slot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it. God, I'm so bad at being eloquent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment later, you hear a large (stone crushing), a large impact sound and a voice say, "Stand back!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We all back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Come with us."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what, might I ask, is your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But I'm not the one you wish to speak with."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hi, I'm Tiberius Stormwind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He turns around and continues walking back towards the forest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me do all the talking this time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you like us to follow you, Your Majesty?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you don't-- yes, family, my brothers and sisters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys continue walking alongside Keyleth, and as you do, most of the druids flank you to each side, about four of them, with arrows still drawn, walking behind you as you progress. They are still armed and keeping a close eye on you as you travel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is really not necessary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just let them do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are kin of Vilya, are you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm... King of Vilya?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Kin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, kin of Vilya. Yes, I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am Cerkonos, the Flamespeaker of Pyrah, the guardian of this rift. Welcome to Pyrah, my "child. I must ask: why have you come?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am here to complete my Aramente. I have already been to the Earth tribe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He crosses his arms for a moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So she came through here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She did. She completed the trial, the challenges, and moved on to continue her Aramente "about ten or so years back."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only ten years ago! She's been gone for close to 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long was she here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, how long was she here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and then her journey took her. I'd hoped wherever "she was, she was safe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I check him to see if he is telling the truth? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your mother was strong of heart and was very "fierce. She could stir the heart of the mountains themselves with a word. She was very well "respected amongst us."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was better than I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hope not." At this moment his face becomes a little darker and he says, "Korren? I "assume he is well?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He is. As stubborn as always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You trust them?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. These are my traveling companions, Vox Machina. They've proven themselves time and time again. We've been together for almost over a year now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you trust them?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do. We actually have a keep now in Emon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. You'll need trust. You are here to learn, then, for your Aramente. To be tested, yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then speak what you've learned to seek, what you wish to learn. What do you lack? What "will be your death?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have actually seen a vision of my death. From not having the will to do what is necessary, for fear of harming others, instead of protecting myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then the test begins now, without preparation. Do you also wish to join her in this "task?"

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first time, you see a smile across his face. Beneath it, you can see the gleaming, white, toothy grin of the man that acknowledges some sort of honor. "Then the trial shall "commence. Come, within Cindergrove." He turns around and heads back into the forest. The rest of the druids have stepped back now. They've left you to your own devices.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A vision of your death?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a tea that they make that is derived from a local plant that-- It's essentially a vision quest tea; it gives you visions. It's a cultural tradition, I guess. I saw two paths. One was an older woman, who was wise and hardened and brave, and she had a line of young Ashari behind her. And I ran away. I feel like she was me. And I ran away, and I went down another path. There was a tree. It was young, but strong, and it had a familiarity. As I reached out and touched it, my vision was taken through the path of the roots, and I could see the world, and I could see how everything was connected, and it took me to you all. And you were strong and fighting and proud, and then Vax yelled out, "This one is for Keyleth!" I wasn't with you. And then Grog yelled out, "This is for our princess!" And it broke away, and I realized that I was that tree, and it was my death. And as I ran to the other side, I went back to the old woman, and all of my people slowly started fading behind her, and as she looked at me, she said, "Your future is as "important as it is fragile. Protect it." And she, too, faded away. I realized she was me. And when I came out of my vision, I talked with the Earth Headmaster Patisse, and she told me that if I was going to survive, I needed to have the will to do what was necessary, and the strength. And ever since the child, it's been hard. I was there for a long time at the Earth Tribe, longer than most stay on their Aramente. I couldn't get through the trial; every time I used a natural magic, every time I tried to fight, I just saw flashes of that child's eyes. I was blocked. Normally, they save the Alore ceremony for the final testament, but they actually started me with the Alore ceremony in order to help hopefully unlock my spiritual blocking that I was having. But I don't know...

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So what now, Your Highness?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Continue on and hope I don't make a fatal mistake. Hope that I can learn.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We won't let that happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope I don't let you guys down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We face this together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (explosion) There's another shake of the ground as you see another spray of molten rock, (spraying) and you hear pattering in the distance of the forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll do this together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're with you to the end.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love you all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you find your way to the center of the forest, and you can see now the source of these molten rock sprays. There is a large crevasse bisecting the center of the forest, about 35 to 40 feet across and about five feet wide that is a pool of slowly roiling lava. You can see the actual air around it is heavily warped by this intense heat that's being released, and all the trees that are immediately around it are all warped and bent and have been burnt to near lack of recognition. Standing there, amongst the edge of it, is Cerkonos with his arms crossed, trained on you, Keyleth.
